â
'''Feather Linux''', created by Robert Sullivan, is a [[Knoppix]]-based [[operating system]] which fits in under 128 MB<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.itwire.com/content/view/13292/53/1/1/|title=Secure web browsing through Live Linux distros|publisher=iTWire|accessdate=2009-02-22}}</ref> (while older versions were made to fit within 64 MB). It boots from either a CD or a [[USB Flash Drive]], into a [[Fluxbox]] [[desktop environment]].<ref>{{citebook|title=Linux Bible 2005 Edition: Boot Up to Ubuntu, Fedora, KNOPPIX, Debian, OpenSUSE, and 11 Other Distributions|first1=Chris |last1=Negus|publisher=John Wiley and Sons|year= 2005|ISBN=0764579495|pages=456|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=HqUzmfa8pWcC&pg=PA456&dq=%22Feather+Linux%22#PPA456,M1}}</ref> It has a wide range of desktop and rescue software, and can load entirely into [[Random access memory|RAM]] (as space permits) or be installed to a hard drive.<ref>{{citation|url=http://featherlinux.berlios.de/about.htm|title=Feather Linux - About|publisher= Feather Linux|date=15 May 2008}}</ref> Feather Linux contains [[GTK+]] applications, such as [[AbiWord]] and [[Pidgin (software)|Pidgin]]. Feather Linux has tried to include software that people would frequently be using on their desktop.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linux.com/feature/55586|title=Linux.com :Feather Linux: Light is right|publisher=www.linux.com|accessdate=2009-02-22}}</ref>
+
'''Feather Linux''', created by Robert Sullivan, is a [[Knoppix]]-based [[operating system]] which fits in under 128 MB<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.itwire.com/content/view/13292/53/1/1/|title=Secure web browsing through Live Linux distros|publisher=iTWire|accessdate=2009-02-22}}</ref> (while older versions were made to fit within 64 MB). It boots from either a CD or a [[USB Flash Drive]], into a [[Fluxbox]] [[desktop environment]].<ref>{{citebook|title=Linux Bible 2005 Edition: Boot Up to Ubuntu, Fedora, KNOPPIX, Debian, OpenSUSE, and 11 Other Distributions|first1=Chris |last1=Negus|publisher=John Wiley and Sons|year= 2005|ISBN=0764579495|pages=456|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=HqUzmfa8pWcC&pg=PA456&dq=%22Feather+Linux%22#PPA456,M1}}</ref> It has a wide range of desktop and rescue software, and can load entirely into [[Random access memory|RAM]] (if enough RAM is available) or be installed to a hard drive.<ref>{{citation|url=http://featherlinux.berlios.de/about.htm|title=Feather Linux - About|publisher= Feather Linux|date=15 May 2008}}</ref> Feather Linux contains [[GTK+]] applications, such as [[AbiWord]] and [[Pidgin (software)|Pidgin]]. Feather Linux has tried to include software that people would frequently be using on their desktop.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linux.com/feature/55586|title=Linux.com :Feather Linux: Light is right|publisher=www.linux.com|accessdate=2009-02-22}}</ref>
With its most recent release being on [[2005-07-04]], Feather Linux is now dormant. Feather Linux and [[Damn Small Linux]] share some common goals.
With its most recent release being on [[2005-07-04]], Feather Linux is now dormant. Feather Linux and [[Damn Small Linux]] share some common goals.
